title: Proof you can die inside Kindred's ult.
body:
It seems even death, cannot save you from death?

Fought kindred, she ulted to save herself.
I tried to sleepy-trouble-bubble her and then R into her ult to save myself and give me a moment for the sleep to take effect.
When I landed inside her ult, I still died.

https://i.gyazo.com/58bbe8d3894f08b5014f33533f52d1b9.png
Here you can clearly see Zoe's HP bar _inside_ Kindred's ult, _(and still with a smidgeon of HP I might add)_. Note the distinct lack of invulnerability around the HP bar.

https://i.gyazo.com/3b4d3e460a690dda6fe96b2016bc780a.png
And here, you can see Zoe's dead body inside the ult, after being hit with an AA.

___________________

And If this is some kind of weird hitbox error; _(actual hitbox lagging behind animation/HP bar during Zoe's ult, or something)_, then I call it a breach of clarity that clearly affects gameplay,_ (**clarity**. Interestingly, a word I haven't seen Riot use in a LOOOONG time.)_

replies.body:
Working this way makes a game run smoothly, although it makes people go "wtf" at times.
Actual missile tracking and hit boxes, such as in an ARPG, is a coding nightmare to get right. MOBAs avoid this and just simplify mechanics, which sometimes looks funky, as in this case.

Believe me, I know.

My many, many years of D2 (since 01) and Median (since 08) have taught me a lot about fundamentals of game mechanics (because Blizzard are trash).

Location isn't the issue, timestamps are.
Sorry, now I'm going into MtG territory.

Timestamps and layers are an important part of MtG, and computer games as well.
I use MtG as an example, as we can see what happens (and have to know the rules), rather than relying on a server to just do it all for us.

Are we all familiar with the stack? First on, last off?

I think that is what is happening here. The auto was launched before Zoe entered the ult, so when it hits it takes her position on launch into account, not position on striking. This is why I referenced PoE, which would do it differently.

Logic makes sense, just not a mechanic I am familiar with, nor did I think League employed it though I wouldn't be surprised to find it did :) Regardless I'm sure there's a reason. Given this all happened in the space of a fraction of a second it could be any number of things anywhere on the spectrum from intended to unintended.

There's always the chance that what you see on your screen (client side) isn't synced up to what's happening server side.
I've experienced it a lot in other games (PoE, looking at you), so expect it can happen in LoL too.

I mean even just normally, if you assume his ping is 40 then there's a window of .08 sec for things to not match up exactly. Such is the nature of online games.

Though it does look like he's still under the Kindred ult when he died and therefore not in it. The auto coulda just followed him, since Zoe's not invulnerable in her ult, it'd just have to be perfect (read: lucky) timing.

Or it could be a bug. Not like Kindred's ult hasn't been prone to them in the past, but given the timing we're looking at here I expect it's a combination of the first two.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=nzoGLpyI,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-05-14T07:35:03.847+0000)
>
> I mean even just normally, if you assume his ping is 40 then there's a window of .08 sec for things to not match up exactly. Such is the nature of online games.
> 
> Though it does look like he's still under the Kindred ult when he died and therefore not in it. The auto coulda just followed him, since Zoe's not invulnerable in her ult, it'd just have to be perfect (read: lucky) timing.
> 
> Or it could be a bug. Not like Kindred's ult hasn't been prone to them in the past, but given the timing we're looking at here I expect it's a combination of the first two.

If the auto (basic) attack was launched before entering the ult radius, but connected inside the radius, this may be working as intended.
This would fit with the fundamental mechanics of games like LoL (as opposed to complicated systems like PoE, where a (non skill-shot for LoL) missile attack wasn't determined to hit on launch, but actually if it strikes you. This means auto/basic attacks don't track, and makes the whole thing WAYYY more complex). In LoL, basic attacks (and point and click abilities) are processed to hit (and damage) on launch, not when they actually strike you.
I've had {{champion:90}} ults on people that {{champion:412}}  lanterned so far away, but the suppresion beam follows with them (like a whole screen diagonally).

[edit] Sorry for referencing PoE so much, but I beta tested the fuck out of that game (and had entire patches implemented on my feedback alone, I even had email chains with the top dog (founder/creator/developer) going. Most people only got staff member feedback, but not me).

Now that one I'm not sure about. As far as I know anything affecting the attacker (like a blind) is calculated at launch (so an auto attack launched before being blinded but hitting after would still hit) but anything affecting the defender (like invulnerability) is calculated at contact (so being un-Zhonya's at launch but Zhonya's at impact would result in no damage).

At least that's what I think you're talking about here.

As far as I know Kindred's ult (assuming you meet the health requirements) would fall under the second scenario, but from the screenshots it looks like he wasn't actually in it yet. 

Zoe's health bar doesn't match up with her target-able model in her ult but I'm pretty sure that's intentional. Her bar shifts as soon as she is untargetable going in, not when she becomes targetable coming out. You can see in the first screenshot, her healthbar has shifted but her model is still just barely in the portal.

The alternatives are:
1. Do the opposite, at which point we'd be clueless as to the moment Zoe actually becomes untargetable 
2. Remove her bar entirely while she is untargetable, at which point it's very easy to lose track of where she is if there's any other effects going on, the screenshots being a very good example of this
3. Have the bar move with her like a Trist W, which would be very hard to track nevermind read, and also misleading because she isn't targetable in that time like Trist is, nor is she a moving target (the target itself is entirely stationary in this time first at point A, then at point B, then back at point A)

Without knowing exactly where that 565 damage came from and whether it was before or after the Zoe ult I can't be sure, but to me it looks like he died just under the ult.

This is a very in-depth analysis guys :)
I wish there was an easy way to share the replays, so others can watch and go over it frame by frame.

There was a lot going on at the time so I'm not 100% sure, but I think there was an auto in flight when I ulted, however because I still have HP when my health bar appears inside the ult, either the auto hit me before I entered and didn't do enough to kill me, OR it hit after I entered, and thats where the 546 damage comes from. Either way, in theory I shouldn't have died from it.

On a side note, I have noticed that when Zoe dies at point B in her ult, her dead body still teleports back to point A. Perhaps that has something to do with it _(the way it is coded as being a 'temporary' position or something)_. I dunno.

Interesting through.

this is probably a stupid answer from a stupid player, 
but maybe portal jumping doesnt work?
